Transfer of Power

This dynasty was founded by Chach, a Brahman minister of the previous Rai dynasty king. After the king's death, Chach seized the throne and laid the foundation of a new dynasty. The main source for his life and reign is the 'Chach Nama', which also chronicles the history of the Arab conquest.

тЪФя╕П
Arab Invasion and Fall

This dynasty came to power at a crucial turning point in historyтАФthe time of the first successful Islamic invasion of India. Raja Dahir, son of Chach, faced the army of the Umayyad Caliphate led by Muhammad bin Qasim in 711-712 CE. Dahir's defeat and death in the Battle of Aror marked the end of Hindu rule in Sindh and the beginning of Islamic rule in the Indian subcontinent.
